Function Documentation

template<class T>
bool operator!= ( const Array< T > &  v,
const ArrayReference< T >  w 
) [inline]

Returns "true" if array "v" and array reference "w" are not equal.

v and w are not equal, if they have different dimensions or at least one element of v is not equal to the corresponding element of w.

Parameters:
v the array
w the array reference
Returns:
"true", when v and w are not equal, "false" otherwise
Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1995
Changes
none
Status
stable

template<class T>
bool operator!= ( const Array< T > &  v,
const Array< T > &  w 
) [inline]

Returns "true" if the two array "v" and "w" are not equal.

The two arrays are not equal, if they have different dimensions or at least one element of v is different to the corresponding element of w.

Parameters:
v the first array
w the second array
Returns:
"true", when v and w are not equal, "false" otherwise
Author:
R. Alberts
Date:
2002-05-15
Changes

Definition at line 430 of file ArrayOp.h.

bool operator!= ( const ArrayIndex &  v,
const ArrayIndex &  w 
) [inline]

Returns "true" if the index arrays "v" and "w" are not equal.

The index array v and w are not equal, if they contain different numbers of elements or at least one index stored in v is not equal to the corresponding index stored in w.

Parameters:
v the first index array that is compared to w
w the second index array that is compared to v
Returns:
"true", if both index arrays are not equal, "false" otherwise
Author:
D. Homberg
Date:
????
Changes
none
Status
stable

Definition at line 654 of file ArrayIndexOp.h.

template<class T>
bool operator< ( const Array< T > &  v,
const Array< T > &  w 
) [inline]

Returns "true" if array "v" is less than array "w".

v is less than w, if v has less elements than w or both have the same number of elements and at least one element of v is less than the corresponding element of w.

Parameters:
v the first array
w the second array
Returns:
"true", when v is less than w, "false" otherwise
Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1995
Changes
none
Status
stable

template<class T>
bool operator== ( const Array< T > &  v,
const ArrayReference< T >  w 
) [inline]

Returns "true" if array "v" and array reference "w" are equal.

v and w are equal, if they have the same dimensions and all elements are equal.

Parameters:
v the array
w the array reference
Returns:
"true", when v and w are equal, "false" otherwise
Author:
M. Kreutz

Definition at line 274 of file ArrayOp.h.

References Array< T >::begin(), Array< T >::end(), and ArrayBase::samedim().

bool operator== ( const ArrayIndex &  v,
const ArrayIndex &  w 
) [inline]

Returns "true" if the index arrays "v" and "w" are equal.

The index array v and w are equal, if they contain the same number of elements and each index stored in v is equal to the corresponding index stored in w.

Parameters:
v the first index array that is compared to w
w the second index array that is compared to v
Returns:
"true", if both index arrays are equal, "false" otherwise
Author:
D. Homberg
Date:
????
Changes
none
Status
stable
